t: Luke 8
Ministering Women
Soon*p afterwards, He began*i going around from one city and village to another, proclaiming and preaching the kingdom of God. The twelve were with Him,
and also*i some women who had been healed of evil spirits and sicknesses: Mary who was called Magdalene, from whom seven demons had gone out,
and Joanna the wife of Chuza, Herod’s steward, and Susanna, and many others who were contributing to their support out of their private means.
Parable of the Sower
When*p a large crowd was coming together, and those from the various cities were journeying to Him, He spoke by way of a parable:

“The*r sower*r went*r out*r to*r sow*r his*r seed;*r and*r as*r he*r sowed,*r some*r fell*r beside*r the*r road,*r and*r it*r was*r trampled*r under*r foot*r and*r the*r birds*r of*r the*r air*r ate*r it*r up.*r
Other*r seed*ir fell*r on*r rocky*r soil,*ir and*r as*r soon*r as*r it*r grew*r up,*r it*r withered*r away,*r because*r it*r had*r no*r moisture.*r
Other*r seed*ir fell*r among*r the*r thorns;*r and*r the*r thorns*r grew*r up*r with*r it*r and*r choked*r it*r out.*r

Other*r seed*ir fell*r into*r the*r good*r soil,*r and*r grew*r up,*r and*r produced*r a*r crop*r a*r hundred*r times*r as*r great.”*r As He said these things, He would call out, “He*r who*r has*r ears*r to*r hear,*r let*r him*r hear.”*r
His*p disciples began*i questioning Him as to what this parable meant.

And He said, “To*r you*r it*r has*r been*r granted*r to*r know*r the*r mysteries*r of*r the*r kingdom*r of*r God,*r but*r to*r the*r rest*r it*ir is*ir in*r parables,*r so*r that*r seeing*sr they*sr may*sr not*sr see,*sr and*sr hearing*sr they*sr may*sr not*sr understand.*sr
“Now*rp the*r parable*r is*r this:*r the*r seed*r is*r the*r word*r of*r God.*r

Those*r beside*r the*r road*r are*r those*r who*r have*r heard;*r then*r the*r devil*r comes*r and*r takes*r away*r the*r word*r from*r their*r heart,*r so*r that*r they*r will*r not*r believe*r and*r be*r saved.*r

Those*r on*r the*r rocky*r soil*ir are*ir those*r who,*r when*r they*r hear,*r receive*r the*r word*r with*r joy;*r and*r these*r have*r no*r firm*ir root;*r they*r believe*r for*r a*r while,*r and*r in*r time*r of*r temptation*r fall*r away.*r

The*r seed*ir which*r fell*r among*r the*r thorns,*r these*r are*r the*r ones*r who*r have*r heard,*r and*r as*r they*r go*r on*r their*r way*r they*r are*r choked*r with*r worries*r and*r riches*r and*r pleasures*r of*r this*ir life,*r and*r bring*r no*r fruit*r to*r maturity.*r

But*r the*r seed*ir in*r the*r good*r soil,*r these*r are*r the*r ones*r who*r have*r heard*r the*r word*r in*r an*r honest*r and*r good*r heart,*r and*r hold*r it*r fast,*r and*r bear*r fruit*r with*r perseverance.*r
Parable of the Lamp

“Now*rp no*r one*r after*r lighting*r a*r lamp*r covers*r it*r over*r with*r a*r container,*r or*r puts*r it*r under*r a*r bed;*r but*r he*r puts*r it*r on*r a*r lampstand,*r so*r that*r those*r who*r come*r in*r may*r see*r the*r light.*r
For*r nothing*r is*r hidden*r that*r will*r not*r become*r evident,*r nor*r anything*ir secret*r that*r will*r not*r be*r known*r and*r come*r to*r light.*r

So*r take*r care*r how*r you*r listen;*r for*r whoever*r has,*r to*r him*r more*ir shall*r be*r given;*r and*r whoever*r does*r not*r have,*r even*r what*r he*r thinks*r he*r has*r shall*r be*r taken*r away*r from*r him.”*r
And*p His mother and brothers came to Him, and they were unable to get to Him because of the crowd.
And it was reported to Him, “Your mother and Your brothers are standing outside, wishing to see You.”
But He answered and said to them, “My*r mother*r and*r My*r brothers*r are*r these*r who*r hear*r the*r word*r of*r God*r and*r do*r it.”*r
Jesus Stills the Sea
Now*p on one of those*i days Jesus and His disciples got into a boat, and He said to them, “Let*r us*r go*r over*r to*r the*r other*r side*r of*r the*r lake.”*r So they launched out.
But as they were sailing along He fell asleep; and a fierce gale of wind descended on the lake, and they began*i to be swamped and to be in danger.
They came to Jesus and woke Him up, saying, “Master, Master, we are perishing!” And He got up and rebuked the wind and the surging waves, and they stopped, and it became calm.
And He said to them, “Where*r is*r your*r faith?”*r They were fearful and amazed, saying to one another, “Who then is this, that He commands even the winds and the water, and they obey Him?”
The Demoniac Cured
Then*p they sailed to the country of the Gerasenes, which is opposite Galilee.

And when He came out onto the land, He was met by a man from the city who was possessed with demons; and who had not put on any clothing for a long time, and was not living in a house, but in the tombs.
Seeing Jesus, he cried out and fell before Him, and said in a loud voice, “What business do we have with each other, Jesus, Son of the Most High God? I beg You, do not torment me.”

For He had commanded the unclean spirit to come out of the man. For it had seized him many times; and he was bound with chains and shackles and kept under guard, and yet*i he would break his bonds and be driven by the demon into the desert.
And Jesus asked him, “What*r is*r your*r name?”*r And he said, “Legion”; for many demons had entered him.
They were imploring Him not to command them to go away into the abyss.
Now*p there was a herd of many swine feeding there on the mountain; and the*i demons*i implored Him to permit them to enter the swine. And He gave them permission.
And the demons came out of the man and entered the swine; and the herd rushed down the steep bank into the lake and was drowned.
When*p the herdsmen saw what had happened, they ran away and reported it in the city and out*i in the country.

The*i people*i went out to see what had happened; and they came to Jesus, and found the man from whom the demons had gone out, sitting down at the feet of Jesus, clothed and in his right mind; and they became frightened.
Those who had seen it reported to them how the man who was demon-possessed had been made well.
And all the people of the country of the Gerasenes and the surrounding district asked Him to leave them, for they were gripped with great fear; and He got into a boat and returned.
But the man from whom the demons had gone out was begging Him that he might accompany Him; but He sent him away, saying,

“Return*r to*r your*r house*r and*r describe*r what*r great*r things*r God*r has*r done*r for*r you.”*r So he went away, proclaiming throughout the whole city what great things Jesus had done for him.
Miracles of Healing
And*p as Jesus returned, the people welcomed Him, for they had all been waiting for Him.
And there came a man named Jairus, and he was an official of the synagogue; and he fell at Jesus’ feet, and began*i to implore Him to come to his house;
for he had an only daughter, about twelve years old, and she was dying. But as He went, the crowds were pressing against Him.
And*p a woman who had a hemorrhage for twelve years, and could not be healed by anyone,
came up behind Him and touched the fringe of His cloak, and immediately her hemorrhage stopped.
And Jesus said, “Who*r is*r the*r one*r who*r touched*r Me?”*r And while they were all denying it, Peter said, “Master, the people are crowding and pressing in on You.”
But Jesus said, “Someone*r did*r touch*r Me,*r for*r I*r was*r aware*r that*r power*r had*r gone*r out*r of*r Me.”*r

When the woman saw that she had not escaped notice, she came trembling and fell down before Him, and declared in the presence of all the people the reason why she had touched Him, and how she had been immediately healed.
And He said to her, “Daughter,*r your*r faith*r has*r made*r you*r well;*r go*r in*r peace.”*r
While*p He was still speaking, someone came from the*i house*i of*i the synagogue official, saying, “Your daughter has died; do not trouble the Teacher anymore.”
But when Jesus heard this,*i He answered him, “Do*r not*r be*r afraid*r any*ir longer;*ir only*r believe,*r and*r she*r will*r be*r made*r well.”*r
When He came to the house, He did not allow anyone to enter with Him, except Peter and John and James, and the girl’s father and mother.
Now they were all weeping and lamenting for her; but He said, “Stop*r weeping,*r for*r she*r has*r not*r died,*r but*r is*r asleep.”*r
And they began*i laughing at Him, knowing that she had died.
He, however, took her by the hand and called, saying, “Child,*r arise!”*r
And her spirit returned, and she got up immediately; and He gave orders for something*i to be given her to eat.
Her parents were amazed; but He instructed them to tell no one what had happened.
